fault.message: Java is running very low on perm-gen memory.

condition.message: Running very low on perm-gen memory in java.

cause.message: Too much perm-gen memory (possibly too many class/objects defined) Not enough memory in perm-gen memory.

resolution.message: 1) In eucalyptus.conf, locate the CLOUD_OPTS variable. 2) Check to see if --XX:MaxPermSize=[value] is included in the CLOUD_OPTS value. 3) If --XX:MaxPermSize value is not set, set it to a relatively large value. Default value is 64MB. (Value can be in bytes, or can be something like '64M' or '1G'. 4) If --XX:MaxPermSize is already set, make the value larger. 5) Restart the cloud application. 6) If after setting --XX:MaxPermSize to the maximum allowable value, this condition continues, it may be necessary to add more physical memory to the machine.
